item.title: RVATukTuk Sightseeing Tour of Richmond
item.description: Many vehicle tours through Richmond can have obstructed views, but this Richmond Tuk-tuk Sightseeing Tour provides a ride around the city in an open-air vehicle that’s easy to see top spots along the way. Plus, this tour stops at Virginia Museum of Fine Arts, Hollywood Cemetery, and Virginia State Capitol and passes more than four popular sites. Book this Richmond tour today and support a woman-owned business.

image.alt: RVATukTuk Sightseeing Tour of Richmond

item.title: Virginia Private Custom Wine Tour from Charlottesville
item.description: With the beauty of the Blue Ridge Mountains surrounding the quaint vineyards of Virginia, this private wine excursion delivers a peaceful and harmonious experience in the great outdoors. A private chauffeur will cruise you and your guests from historic Charlottesville to the countryside. Spend the day touring the area and sampling wines from multiple wineries. On the Wine Trail, you’ll have your choice of which tasting rooms to visit and when to have a picnic lunch.

image.alt: Virginia Private Custom Wine Tour from Charlottesville

item.title: Williamsburg Ghosts, Witches and Pirates Tour
item.description: Immerse yourself in the atmospheric setting of Colonial Williamsburg after dark—and learn all about the real-life murders, executions, and other sordid events that happened here—on this nighttime ghost tour. No separate ticket to Williamsburg is needed: meet your costumed guide at the Capitol Building and set off. Visit supposedly haunted landmarks like the Peyton Randolph House, and hear stories about pirates, witch trials, and more as you go.

image.alt: Williamsburg Ghosts, Witches and Pirates Tour

item.title: Chincoteague's Up The Bay Pony and Wildlife Tour by Boat
item.description:
*Our mission is to make your tour the highlight of your vacation! We will do everything we can to make that happen! Our captain is a local who has navigated these waters for over 40 years!
*Our tours are a Full 2 hours around Chincoteague and Assateague! We run all brand new boats and travel over 25 miles of coastline.
*Our tours allow you to have the best, up close and personal experience to see ponies and other wildlife such as eagles, ospreys, herons, egrets, pelicans, dolphin, and beautiful sunsets around Chincoteague and Assateague Islands.
*Each experience includes a tour of the island and cruise through small guts and waterways to get you up close to an abundance of wildlife and scenery.
*We look forward to sharing our Island with you!
*We also do private tours! Check out our website for different options!
*www.upthebayponytours.com

image.alt: Chincoteague's Up The Bay Pony and Wildlife Tour by Boat

item.title: Sunset Dolphin Kayak Tours
item.description: Watch the sun set over Chesapeake Bay on a 2-hour, small-group dolphin tour by kayak from Virginia Beach. Paddle along the coast as you spot Atlantic bottlenose dolphins, and see the Cape Henry Lighthouses and Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel from the water.

image.alt: Sunset Dolphin Kayak Tours

item.title: Small Group Dolphin Kayak Eco-Tour
item.description: Paddle alongside the wild dolphins of Virginia Beach on a small-group kayak tour from North End Beach. Watch for sea birds and other wildlife as you steer an easy to use, sit-on-top kayak along the coast to the Cape Henry Lighthouses. Learn about the Atlantic bottlenose dolphins that swim past the Virginia coast each summer, and explore the shore with an experienced guide.

image.alt: Small Group Dolphin Kayak Eco-Tour

item.title: Full Day Historic Guided Tour to Jamestown and Yorktown with Lunch
item.description: Visit the Historic Triangle and learn about early American history with this full-day group tour of Jamestown, Yorktown, and other sites. Travel comfortably in an air-conditioned vehicle with a driver-guide and go to each site in chronological order. Enjoy a midday stop for a Colonial-style lunch at a local restaurant.

image.alt: Full Day Historic Guided Tour to Jamestown and Yorktown with Lunch

item.title: Full-Day Tour in Washington DC
item.description: See Washington DC’s key attractions, all in one day—and leave the navigation to your guide—on this full-day tour from Williamsburg. Set off early in the morning via air-conditioned bus, and stop by Arlington National Cemetery en route to the nation’s capital. Then, discover highlights like the Lincoln Memorial, see the White House and US Capitol, enjoy free time for lunch (own expense) and a stroll, and more.

image.alt: Full-Day Tour in Washington DC

item.title: Jamestown Settlement American Revolution Museum 7-Day Ticket
item.description: The Jamestown Settlement is a living history museum located just 15 minutes by car from Colonial Williamsburg. This 7–day pass with complimentary free parking allows you to explore Jamestown at your own pace with breaks in between—a convenient choice for families with children. Your admission ticket grants you access to films, historical interpreters, working farms, and recreated colonial spaces.

image.alt: Jamestown Settlement American Revolution Museum 7-Day Ticket

item.title: Richmond Downtown Walking Tour
item.description: This leisurely stroll takes you through downtown Richmond with a guide who will tell you about the layers of history all around you. Talk about the town’s role in the Revolution, Civil War, and more. This is a small group tour, so you’ll keep costs down by sharing your guide, but still have an intimate tour group. You’ll also be wearing a headset on tour to encourage safe distancing.

image.alt: Richmond Downtown Walking Tour

item.title: Freedom's Fight in Alexandria
item.description: Learn all about Alexandria’s African-American history and cultural heritage on this guided walking tour of the city. As you explore the streets of Old Town, your guide will share stories of the individuals who lived there, from enslaved tavern workers to the abolitionists who led the fight for freedom.

image.alt: Freedom's Fight in Alexandria

item.title: Arts District Food Tour in Richmond
item.description: Discover Richmond’s food, history, and culture on this guided walking tour through the city’s recently established Arts District. Try food tastings from a variety of local restaurants and cafes. Visit a rotating selection of establishments in Richmond's Arts District. Along the way, sample coal-fired pizzas, Korean street eats, Southern soul food, and more.

image.alt: Arts District Food Tour in Richmond

item.title: Patriots Tour of Colonial Williamsburg or Williamsburg 101
item.description: Spend an entertaining and educational hour with a local guide who’s more than happy to share what they know about this historic town. Learn all about how events in the 1770s shaped America as it’s known today, and gain fresh insight into the attitudes of the founding fathers. Your friendly tour leader would love for you to pick their brain.

image.alt: Patriots Tour of Colonial Williamsburg or Williamsburg 101

item.title: The Carytown Food Tour in Richmond
item.description: Discover Carytown’s food, history and culture on this walking tour near Richmond, Virginia. Try food tastings from five or six local restaurants, cafes and shops. Visit East Coast Provisions, Xtra's Cafe, Don't Look Back, Virginia Diner Shoppe and Carytown Cupcakes. Along the way, sample local seafood, world-famous tacos, popular Virginia peanuts and learn about the Mile of Style’s colorful history.

image.alt: The Carytown Food Tour in Richmond

item.title: RVA Ghosts Shockoe Bottom Sinister Scares by US Ghost Adventures
item.description: See a different side of Virginia’s capital city during this Richmond Ghosts and Haunted Dark History Walking Tour. Instead of regular sightseeing, you’ll dive into documented accounts of historical hauntings and true stories of history with a guide who knows the area and its chilly tales well. Visit up to 12 locations, including Adam Craig House, C&O Church Hill Tunnel West Portal, Jefferson Park, Edgar Allan Poe Museum, Libby Prison, and Masons' Hall.

image.alt: RVA Ghosts Shockoe Bottom Sinister Scares by US Ghost Adventures

item.title: Haunted Old Town Alexandria Booze and Boos Ghost Walking Tour
item.description: Uncover Old Town Alexandria’s haunted history on a small-group walking tour and pub crawl. Stroll past the city’s 18th-century townhouses and secret alleyways while listening to ghostly tales from your costumed guide. Stop at historic pubs along the way to fill up on liquid courage before continuing on to other eerie locations.

image.alt: Haunted Old Town Alexandria Booze and Boos Ghost Walking Tour

item.title: Richmond Landmark Segway Tour
item.description: Cover more Richmond sights in less time with a Richmond Segway tour. This tour lets you glide around Virginia’s capital city with ease, taking you to top sights like the Canal Walk, Old City Hall, and St. Paul’s Church, all while filling you in facts and stories from Richmond history. Choose from multiple tour durations and departure times to find a tour that fits your schedule.

image.alt: Richmond Landmark Segway Tour

item.title: A Guided Walking Tour through Historic Old Town Alexandria
item.description: Learn all about the storied past of this historic area of Alexandria from an engaging guide who’s passionate about making your trip to the city a memorable one—from Gadsby's Tavern Museum to the cobblestone streets of Captain’s Row. You’ll hear well-researched stories, explore local landmarks, and get familiar with Old Town as a local leads the way.

image.alt: A Guided Walking Tour through Historic Old Town Alexandria

item.title: Let's Go Sail the York River in Gloucester Point, Virginia
item.description: The York River is a favorite spot for boaters of all size vessels. Get out on the water and experience the joy of sailing down the York on this cruise launching from Gloucester Point. Join your captain on a 32-foot sloop and ride down the York at a relaxed pace. Find a quiet place to enjoy the view on the bow of the boat. Aspiring sailors can head to the helm, hoist the spinnaker, and captain the boat.

image.alt: Let's Go Sail the York River in Gloucester Point, Virginia

item.title: Grand Boat Tour around Chincoteague and Assateague Islands
item.description: Our guides are locals and have local knowledge of all the wildlife and island history. All of our guides are licensed Captains.

image.alt: Grand Boat Tour around Chincoteague and Assateague Islands

item.title: Ziplining and Climbing at The Adventure Park at Virginia Aquarium
item.description: Ages five and older can enjoy this aerial adventure park near the Virginia Aquarium & Marine Science Center’s Marsh Pavilion. The six-acre site features 16 trails that weave between ziplining platforms in the canopy above. Perfect for birthday parties, scout groups, corporate events, team building programs, school field trips, and families, the course offers a wonderful opportunity to spend a day in nature.

image.alt: Ziplining and Climbing at The Adventure Park at Virginia Aquarium

item.title: Private Tour of Colonial Williamsburg & Sir Christopher Wren Bldg
item.description: If you’re interested in learning about Williamsburg’s Colonial history then this private tour saves hours doing your own independent research. Join a private guide on a walk around the city with insightful commentary throughout. The route is customizable to help ensure its tailored to your preferences, and stops include the Capitol Building, the Williamsburg Inn, the William and Mary College, and Governor’s Palace.

image.alt: Private Tour of Colonial Williamsburg & Sir Christopher Wren Bldg

item.title: Escape Room Live Alexandria: 60-Minute Adventures
item.description: Participate in a different type of activity when you book this escape room adventure in Old Town Alexandria. Your dedicated guide leads the way as you race against time to complete the mission. Team up, solve puzzles, find clues, and escape the room. Test your skills in immersive games like Sherlock Holmes: A Matter of Time and Edgar Allan Poe: Poe-ranormal Activity. Choose from four uniquely challenging experiences, where teamwork, wit, and adventure are the keys to success.

image.alt: Escape Room Live Alexandria: 60-Minute Adventures

item.title: Downtown Roanoke Food, History & Cultural Tour
item.description: Discover Roanoke’s food, history, architecture and culture on this 3-hour, small-group walking tour. Try up to seven food tastings from local restaurants and specialty food shops. Visit the Hotel Roanoke, one of the top historic hotels in the US, plus Cedars Lebanese Restaurant, the famed Texas Tavern, and the most locally sourced downtown restaurant. Along the way, uncover hidden gems, iconic landmarks, back alleys and the Star City’s colorful history.

image.alt: Downtown Roanoke Food, History & Cultural Tour
